result.execSummary:
The defendant Laniqua D Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $100.00 including costs and surcharges.  To be paid by 1/6/2017.  If not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Submit a  DNA sample/pay the DNA surcharge.
Court denied defense request for expungement.

Complete a course in anger management.
Mental health evaluation/treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laniqua D Lyons

records.addlTxt: Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Laniqua D Lyons in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case in court for return on warrant.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Br. 4.  Signature bond was not previously forfeited.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  BAIL NOT FORFEITED.

Defendant Laniqua D Lyons in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laniqua D Lyons in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for Plea hearing.  Defense request more time. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laniqua D Lyons in court with attorney Reyna Morales for Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Laniqua D Lyons in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Laniqua D Lyons in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Laniqua D Lyons
Current: 1818 West Fairmount Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53211   (Effective: 03-29-2016)
Prior: 1818 West Fairmount Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Laniqua D Lyons not in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
